text: Hi <@U013TUP19PS>, thank you very much for the loom. That definitely helps to solve a few issues. But it remains a challenge to have the service reps select the right template and we have the additional issue that we need to make sure the right “from” address is used. But I already heard from HubSpot product management that they will look into it and hopefully add more configuration options for the send dialog.
<@U01NMMDTERZ> Any update on this? We're still having the same issue this morning.

Hi Everyone!
Has anyone been able to successfully create an extension card and upload it to production using the new component `StatusTag` ? I managed to render it on my local development environment but every time I try and upload it, it fails and I can’t figure out what I’m doing wrong :sweat_smile:
Morning! Make sure you have the most up to date version of the extensions in your package.json file by running `npm i` `@HubSpot/ui-extensions` in your extensions directory.
We're looking into this on our end. Will reach out as soon as we have an update
Thanks <@U05KNCMAE7N>
How is this onCrmPropertiesUpdate happening, ? Can you paste some of the code around how this is implemented?
Update: We have identified the issue. We're working on a fix right now
We've just fixed the issue on the Records page. <@U07EHBPLGLA> <@U04RDS77QF7> <@U04AWEE4J10> could you confirm that your cards now work as expected?
Thanks <@U05KNCMAE7N>. I can confirm that it is working as expected on our end.
<@U05KNCMAE7N> Working as expected now! Thank you!

Is this the `crm-cards` project?
yes
is it time to `rf -rm` ?
lol

If so, it looks like it's using an older version of `<@UDA553DRD>/ui-extensions` package.
The way npm handles this is confusing in my opinion.

The `package.json` has `"<@UDA553DRD>/ui-extensions": "latest",` which looks perfect.

BUT, if you look in package-lock.json, I see this:
okay I didn’t bother to check that
Nobody ever does (me included), which is why I think it's a confusing npm thing.
should I delete `package-lock.json` and `npm install`
I believe if you run `npm i @HubSpot/ui-extensions@latest`  it should actually update it to use the latest
I need to confirm this, but I believe running `npm install` will pull down the versions listed in package-lock,json, but it won't update the version that's installed.
But if you re-run the `npm i @HubSpot/ui-extensions@latest` command it goes out and figures out what the latest version is, and updates the packge-lock and installs the new version
works if I remove casing in HubSpot
Ah yeah, sorry about that. It thought I was trying to tag the `@HubSpot` user in slack and changed the casing on me

That looks fixed to me :+1:

I think you can run some commands to verify, like:
`npm show @HubSpot/ui-extensions version`   <== this prints out the latest version published to the npm registry
`npm list @HubSpot/ui-extensions`  <== this should print out the version that's installed locally

Oh no! Damn, I thought we figured it out.

Okay, I'll lay out a couple options:

• That looks like a local build... did you restart the local server after your latest npm install updates?
• What happens if you commit and upload?
The most recently uploaded build (227) still has the old npm package, which you can see in the projects UI. So I'm wondering if trying that upload can help out, so we can have the build run on the remote build envioronment which does a full reset and build each time, so no lingering `node_modules` things to worry about

If it builds correctly when you upload, but not locally, that usually means you should try `rm -rf node_nodules` or you can use `npm ci` which will do a <https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/v10/commands/npm-ci|"clean install">:
> This command is similar to `npm install`, except it's meant to be used in automated environments such as test platforms, continuous integration, and deployment -- or any situation where you want to make sure you're doing a clean install of your dependencies.

HEY, back here.

So I did do a  push and a reset of hs project dev, but I just did this again to make sure my memory doesn’t fail me
It did not build correctly when I pushed to repo, and it isn’t working locally still
I yeeted the node_modules directory, reinstalled packages, still the same issue here locally
The latest build log (228) is still showing version `0.8.11` in the package-lock.json where I am looking. Does that match what you see in the Projects build output?
in the projects build outpuet? What is that referencing
I deleted `package-lock.json` file and `npm install`
I search for 0.8.11

It's inside the HubSpot app:
• Click on CRM Development in the left nav
• Then click Projects in the nav
• Click into your project
• Click into the Activity tab at the top
• Click the "View Details" link on the right of the latest build
From there it will list the contents of all the files in your build

yeah thats the screen I’m on, sorry

In the extensions folder is good, that's what you want
In the last screenshot where you did `npm list` it looks like that was run from the project root
I started on dos when I was 7 years old
So I'm just trying to make sure we didn't update the wrong package.json
i did do npm list from the root
as I would assume that everything cascades but I guess I’m in correct

My guess is if you look at the project root there will now be an entry for `<@UDA553DRD>/ui-extensions`  and that's where the confusion is coming from.

When I run npm list from the root, it shows nothing. But inside the extensions directory, I get the right result:

SO, after I removed the latest and hard coded the version in the `extensions/package-lock.json` file, then installed….

I then redelted extension/package-lock.json redid it back to latest adn it appears to be working now
:disappointed_relieved:  Man, it can get so confusing with nested package.json files, and having multiple places we need to run these commands from
I'm sorry for the confusion there.
okay, so I’m guessing when I did the force install I was in the root and not in my other tab
and that is why it isntalled in the root
Yes, I think that's what happened.
so that could have been my mistake
It's common, I've done it a hundred times.
Welll.... :slightly_smiling_face:
We're already talking about this on the team, about how to improve this, so I'll share this additional datapoint. This needs to be easier
lol I’ve done some terrible things with git repos, and I say 100, but like after 4 times I learned my lesson
It certainly feels like 100 times because of how frustrated I get when I do it
I’m there with you
Okay, hopefully you're all good and on your way now. If not, let me know. And have a great night!
BUILT!
Thank you
So —
:raised_hands:
The version didn’t update to latest
was serving old modal stuff (I’m guessing this was before overlay was forced is what that version was)
or something
or it didn’t have it
anyways
Do we know why it didn’t update?
I had some time, normally I just look up latest version and force it and say “someone else is going to contact support about this”

Yep, this is how I see it:
• package-lock.json was loading an old version despite us not wanting that. So we had to force it to udate
• Then one of those commands was run in project root instead of in the extensions folder, so it installed it further up the tree, but didn't update the one in /extensions
• then we were in a confusing mixed world where it's hard to know what's going on :joy:
yup okay, I hope this is a one off issue and you don’t have to worry about it anymore Ben, I appreciate your time
Of course, good luck with your app! Have a great night
same same
and I don’t even really need this modal, I just wanted my debugging stuff while I work through the clients stuff to be able to see this or have them take a screen shot for me
I just didn’t want to print it, otherwise there is no need for a modal. This is what I get for trying to go the extra mile, I could printed the data at the bottom of the app
smh
All good! Once I get locked on a problem, I've got to follow it through to the end :joy:
